strategy.target_audience: Gen Z and Millennials (18-30 years old) in Tashkent. Segments: 1) Students from regions (Viloyat) moving to the capital for university. 2) Young professionals wanting to move out of parents' houses but sensitive to rent prices. 3) 'Relocants' looking for Russian-speaking flatmates. They hate 'Maklers' (realtors) and high commissions.
strategy.uvp: Hamxona is the 'Tinder for Roommates' in Tashkent. No greedy realtors (Maklers), no 50% commission fees, just direct peer-to-peer connections via a fast Telegram Bot. Find a flatmate who matches your vibe, not just your budget.
channels: University Telegram Chats (Westminster, UWED, Amity, etc.)
Instagram Reels (Reposting TikTok style skits about bad roommates)
OLX (Guerrilla marketing: posting 'Roommate wanted' ads that lead to the bot)
strategy.viral_mechanics: The 'VIP Access' Loop: Users can search for 3 roommates for free. To unlock unlimited swipes or see contact details immediately, they must share their personal referral link to 3 friends or 1 group chat. This forces distribution into private networks.

posts.text:
üö© **5 Red Flags When Choosing a Roommate in Tashkent**

Before you say 'Yes' and move your mattress in, check these vibes. We asked 500 students, and here is what they hate most:

1Ô∏è‚É£ **The 'Ghost' Payer:** Says 'I'll pay rent on Monday' every single month. (Bro, the landlord is waiting outside).
2Ô∏è‚É£ **The Plov Thief:** Eats your food but never buys groceries. 'I thought it was communal!' ü•ò
3Ô∏è‚É£ **The 24/7 Guest:** Their boyfriend/girlfriend practically lives there but pays $0 rent.
4Ô∏è‚É£ **The AC dictator:** Keeps the AC on 18¬∞C when it's freezing, or turns it off when it's +40¬∞C outside to 'save money.'
5Ô∏è‚É£ **No Boundaries:** Uses your towel. Just... don't.

üõ°Ô∏è **Protect yourself:** Use the **Hamxona Bot** to view verified profiles and habits before you meet.

üëâ @HamxonaBot
posts.image_prompt: A minimalist flat vector illustration divided into two sides. Left side: A messy room with a chaotic roommate. Right side: A clean, zen room with a happy roommate. Text overlay: 'Choose Wisely'.

posts.text:
ü§° **Bingo: The 'Tashkent Rental' Experience**

How many points do you have?

[ ] Landlord comes to check the flat at 7 AM on Sunday.
[ ] 'Only for family' (but you are single students).
[ ] The price is in USD but you pay in Soums at the bazaar rate.
[ ] The apartment is 'Euro-renovation' (aka just new wallpaper).
[ ] Internet cuts off when it rains.
[ ] Your roommate invites 10 people for Osh without asking.

**Score:**
0-2: You are lucky.
3-5: Average Tashkent life.
6: You need **Hamxona** immediately.

üòÇ **Share your score in the comments!** And tag a friend who suffers from this.

Find a better place here: @HamxonaBot
posts.image_prompt: A Bingo card grid graphic. Each square contains a funny illustration of the text points (e.g., an angry landlord, a pile of cash, a router with a red light).
